definitions.example: Mother couldn't unravel the ball of wool after the cat had played with it.

definitions.definition: (of threads, etc.) To become separated; (of something woven, knitted, etc.) to come apart.
To clear from complication or difficulty; to unfold; to solve.
To separate the connected or united parts of; to throw into disorder; to confuse.
definitions.example: to unravel the broad consensus which was created
